If the problem is only a short disconnect from SessionStore/Cache, a simple reboot would be sufficient. However, if it is always the same session that triggers an error, the error would happen regularly but also be logged. With the help of log monitoring, the administrator can be informed about repeated errors.

Not all implementations of ByteSource can be serializable. For example if the source was an input stream.  That said, it should be easy store marshal/unmarshal to any custom store by just calling `getBytes()` or `toBase64()` 

@ChunMengLu do you have a custom Session Cache?

@ChunMengLu Lets take a step back.
Are you seeing a unmarshalling  error when reading an object from the cache/session?

@DR-YangLong can you write in english please?

if you just went share session,look at the interface [Session](https://github.com/apache/shiro/blob/master/core/src/main/java/org/apache/shiro/session/Session.java) and the default implemention [SimpleSession ](https://github.com/apache/shiro/blob/master/core/src/main/java/org/apache/shiro/session/mgt/SimpleSession.java).the default implemention just can use JDK Serializer to serialize/deserialize.

> if you just went share session,look at the interface [Session](https://github.com/apache/shiro/blob/master/core/src/main/java/org/apache/shiro/session/Session.java) and the default implemention [SimpleSession ](https://github.com/apache/shiro/blob/master/core/src/main/java/org/apache/shiro/session/mgt/SimpleSession.java).the default implemention just can use JDK Serializer to serialize/deserialize.

I use EnterpriseCacheSessionDAO and Only the cacheManager was rediscoveredã€‚

Just FYI Re: shiro and karaf

It's not finished yet (as in deployed to maven central), but this is a minimal JDBC-based user system for karaf (currently using shiro 1.3.1): https://github.com/steinarb/authservice

Points of interest:

1. [uses code and OSGi service dependency injection to configure shiro](https://github.com/steinarb/authservice/blob/master/authservice.web.security/src/main/java/no/priv/bang/authservice/web/security/AuthserviceShiroFilter.java#L73) (shiro.ini can't be used, because the OSGi classloader is unable to find the shiro classes.  [The use of shiro.ini is limited to the [urls] section](https://github.com/steinarb/authservice/blob/master/authservice.web.security/src/main/resources/shiro.ini)). The injected OSGi services are Realm and Session

2. [Uses liquibase to set up the schema and initial data](https://github.com/steinarb/authservice/blob/master/authservice.db.liquibase/src/main/resources/db-changelog/db-changelog-1.0.0.xml#L6), which means that it can easily be adapted to any JDBC database supported by liquibase (which is basically all of them), currently I'm using derby memory database for tests and PostgreSQL for production

3. Has a JDBC realm that supports base64 encoded salt (see [SHIRO-552](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/SHIRO-552)) (I'm working on a pull rquest for this, but it stranded on the OSGi issues that you are currently working)

4. has a very small GUI for logging in and letting users change their own passwords and email/real name (no actual frontend, just bootstrap-styled HTML delivered by jersey). There is also a jersey resource in this module that allows nginx to use shiro for authentication

5. has a react application for user management, the react application's jersey backend communicates with its business logic through [this OSGi service](https://github.com/steinarb/osgi-service/blob/master/osgiservice.users/src/main/java/no/priv/bang/osgiservice/users/UserManagementService.java#L33)

@bdemers as we have no update about the user, can I merge this and made the update in the `Subject` `isAuthenticated` method in another PR?

@fpapon i think we would want to figure out how/why a subject is authenticated without a principal.

Possibly making the default `isAuthenticated()` check for a principal.  But i think understanding what happened is our first step

@bdemers ok, if I understand the use case, this is about the serialization of the `Principal`. Sometimes it cannot be serialize and became null in the session after restarting the web container. 
May be we can check why `Principal` is not serialized?
AHH!! maybe adding the null check to `isAuthenticated()` is the way to go then?
Yes I think so :)

I think we could add `&& hasPrincipals()` here:
https://github.com/apache/shiro/blob/22a2612056485a06507b644f0d1a61b0ac437d04/core/src/main/java/org/apache/shiro/subject/support/DelegatingSubject.java#L297

Thanks for taking this on!

I think we should try to simplify this a little more to make this easier for contributors.
Maybe ending with something like `mvn clean install -Pci` or possibly three options "normal", `ci`, `fast`
Anything more advanced, and someone can start adding other maven plugin flags?


Thinking (typing) out loud, but my main concern is when submodules are hidden behind profiles, IDE's and cross project dependencies can start seeing issues that are not obvious at first.  My personal pref is to to still process the module, but skip the tests via a profile (this assumes that the compile/packaging is fast enough to impact developers)
![Compiling](https://imgs.xkcd.com/comics/compiling.png "Compiling")

> Thanks for taking this on!
> 
> I think we should try to simplify this a little more to make this easier for contributors.
> Maybe ending with something like `mvn clean install -Pci` or possibly three options "normal", `ci`, `fast`
> Anything more advanced, and someone can start adding other maven plugin flags?
> 
> Thinking (typing) out loud, but my main concern is when submodules are hidden behind profiles, IDE's and cross project dependencies can start seeing issues that are not obvious at first. My personal pref is to to still process the module, but skip the tests via a profile (this assumes that the compile/packaging is fast enough to impact developers)
> ![Compiling](https://camo.githubusercontent.com/d34da8961642057a4b7ebaee28e365320049e461/68747470733a2f2f696d67732e786b63642e636f6d2f636f6d6963732f636f6d70696c696e672e706e67)

Yeah I like it :)

Ok I see what you have in mind, I will take a look more deeper and make it work with "normal", `ci` and `fast` profile ;)
Thanks for your feedback!
